page.title: 02Weare and District
page.content: Field sizes in the district around Weare tend to be dictated by drainage rhynes and new housing by drainage and sewage related problems. The houses are occupied by managerial personnel involved in finance, selling and technical industries. Many elderly people retire to the area but few of the native stock can afford to buy property. Very few residents earn their living in the area. Most people are car owners and travel considerable distances to work. One "B" road straddles the area with minor roads linking to it and tracks and droves provide access to farms. Pavements rarely exist and road lighting is nil. Public transport is non existent and most entertainment is in the larger towns within a 25 mile radius.Local societies and groups do exist mainly in Weare and Allerton.
